  'max': 1,
  'step': 0,

})

Stereo crossfader.

tags.title: output
tags.description:
change Fires any time the interface's value changes.
The event data is an object containing the interface's value (-1 to 1), as well as L and R amplitude values (0-1) for left and right speakers, calculated by a square-root crossfade algorithm.

children.value: The position of crossfader, from -1 (left) to 1 (right). Setting this value updates the interface and triggers the output event.

Interface for moving a sound around an array of speakers. Speaker locations can be customized. The interface calculates the closeness of the sound source to each speaker and returns that distance as a numeric value.

tags.title: description
tags.description: Interface for moving a sound around an array of speakers. Speaker locations can be customized. The interface calculates the closeness of the sound source to each speaker and returns that distance as a numeric value.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
var pan2d = new Nexus.Pan2D('#target',{
  'size': [200,200],
  'range': 0.5,  // detection radius of each speaker
  'mode': 'absolute',   // 'absolute' or 'relative' sound movement
  'speakers': [  // the speaker [x,y] positions
      [0.5,0.2],
      [0.75,0.25],
      [0.8,0.5],
      [0.75,0.75],
      [0.5,0.8],
      [0.25,0.75]
      [0.2,0.5],
      [0.25,0.25]
  ]
})

tags.title: output
tags.description:
change Fires any time the "source" node's position changes.
The event data is an array of the amplitudes (0-1), representing the level of each speaker (as calculated by its distance to the audio source).

examples.description:
var pan2d = new Nexus.Pan2D('#target',{
  'size': [200,200],
  'range': 0.5,  // detection radius of each speaker
  'mode': 'absolute',   // 'absolute' or 'relative' sound movement
  'speakers': [  // the speaker [x,y] positions
      [0.5,0.2],
      [0.75,0.25],
      [0.8,0.5],
      [0.75,0.75],
      [0.5,0.8],
      [0.25,0.75]
      [0.2,0.5],
      [0.25,0.25]
  ]
})

children.value: Absolute or relative mouse interaction. In "absolute" mode, the source node will jump to your mouse position on mouse click. In "relative" mode, it does not.
An array of speaker locations. Update this with .moveSpeaker() or .moveAllSpeakers()

Rewrite: The maximum distance from a speaker that the source node can be for it to be heard from that speaker. A low range (0.1) will result in speakers only playing when the sound is very close it. Default is 0.5 (half of the interface).
The current levels for each speaker. This is calculated when a source node or speaker node is moved through interaction or programatically.
Move the audio source node and trigger the output event.
{number} New x location, normalized 0-1
{number} New y location, normalized 0-1
Move a speaker node and trigger the output event.

tags.title: param
tags.description: {number} Index of the speaker to move
tags.name: index

children.value: {number} Index of the speaker to move
{number} New x location, normalized 0-1
{number} New y location, normalized 0-1
Set all speaker locations

tags.title: param
tags.name: locations

children.value: {Array} Array of speaker locations. Each item in the array should be an array of normalized x and y coordinates.
setSpeakers(locations) {

Two-dimensional touch slider.

  'minX': 0,
  'maxX': 1,
  'stepX': 0,
  'y': 0.5,  // initial y value
  'minY': 0,
  'maxY': 1,
  'stepY': 0
})

  'maxX': 1,
  'stepX': 0,
  'y': 0.5,  // initial y value
  'minY': 0,
  'maxY': 1,
  'stepY': 0
})

children.value: Update the list of options. This removes all existing options and creates a new list of options.

Grid of buttons with built-in step sequencer.

tags.title: description
tags.description: Grid of buttons with built-in step sequencer.

tags.title: output
tags.description:
change Fires any time the interface's matrix changes.
The event data is an object containing row (number), column (number), and state (boolean) properties.

tags.title: output
tags.description:
step Fires any time the sequencer steps to the next column, in sequece mode.
The event data is an array containing all values in the column, top first.

children.value: The interval object which controls timing and sequence scheduling.
A Matrix model containing methods for manipulating the sequencer's array of values. To learn how to manipulate the matrix, read about the matrix model.
A Counter model which the sequencer steps through. For example, you could use this model to step through the sequencer in reverse, randomly, or in a drunk walk.
Start sequencing
Beat tempo in milliseconds
Stop sequencing
Manually jump to the next column and trigger the 'change' event. The "next" column is determined by your mode of sequencing.
Number of rows in the sequencer
Number of columns in the sequencer
